ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the various aspects of someone's life that influence their health.
Issues regarding social determinants of health

As a clinician, I came  the social and behavioral contributions to health. I understood how one's neighborhood, social policies, stress and health disparities could influence health.
I learnt how to apply the knowledge acquired in class to addressing a major health issue in Ghana in an op-ed, which I had written for the first time.
The structure of the class allowed for a lot of interaction with classmates from different racial, ethnic and continental backgrounds.
I learned foundational concepts on Social and Behavioral Science in the public health setting.

I learned how to think more critically about the different social determinants of health. I also had never done an oped and this class provided the opportunity to do so. This allowed me to get back into writing and think about problems that are important to me.
Social disparities, health inequity, stigma, neighborhoods
I learned a lot about racial disparities in the United States.

This course helped me develop the following:

1. understanding of the numerous factors at play in determining health of a community and individual,
2. knowledge of the social determinants of health and the policies for intervention,
3. ability to determine the impact of stigma, neighborhoods and other social factors in the health of an individual
4. able to critically analyze the impact of a policy on the health of target population and the need for improvisation in order to truly affect the population at risk
I learned the various principles of behavioural sciences.

Great foundational knowledge on SBS. How to think of a subject like SBS through a structural lens and breaking down issues from multiple perspectives. Understanding more about causal diagrams, mediators, topics like stigma, neighbourhoods and their impact on health was great. The course allowed me to think about these topics in a more structured manner.

(1) I developed a sense of how much of the inequities in our healthcare system have their foundations in structural, social, and behavioral systems.
(2) I learned about some of the generalizable models that are used to describe and test many of the hypotheses about how certain determinants play a role in public health.
(3) I gained greater knowledge of many social existing inequities and what their root causes might be.
(4) I gained some sense of how to bridge the gap between having knowledge of these systemic inequities and putting this knowledge into action as a public health professional in implementation solutions and influencing political, economic, and social change.

narratives.question_text: What actions did you take that helped your learning in this course?
comments: I showed up to class and listened attentively to what the lecturer had to say.
Unsure

Watching videos posted ahead of class
Participating in class discussions
Doing assignments
I attempted to keep up with the readings throughout the course.
Be more present in class and actively participate.
Attend class, reviewed readings and slides, participated in class
Actively participating in class, asking questions, relating the content we covered to my personal experiences.
Attending classes, actively engaging in lectures and reading through discussion papers helped me learn the course material.
Reading review articles and lecture slides

This course allowed for maximum peer learning. It was an enriching experience to hear people from different parts of the world discuss issues of stigma, neighborhoods, socio-economic status, and their impact on health. So I would say active listening and peer engagement were actions that helped me in my learning in this course.

(1) I tried to consistently do the readings and watch the videos.
(2) If I had any questions about the material, I would follow up with the instructor either during or after class.
(3) I listened a lot to classmates who had life and career experience with many of the topics brought up in the course.
